meanings.definition: A person who habitually criticizes or scolds others.
meanings.sent1: The scolds in the neighborhood always have something negative to say.
meanings.sent2: The new student was labeled as a scolds by his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The scolds at the park were like broken records, repeating the same complaints.
meanings.sent4: Her inner critic was the loudest scolds she had ever encountered.
meanings.sent5: The scolds in the office made everyone feel demotivated and unappreciated.

meanings.definition: To find fault with angrily; chide; reprimand.
meanings.sent1: She scolds her dog whenever it misbehaves.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolds the students for not completing their homework.
meanings.sent3: The chef scolds the burnt toast as if it had personally offended him.
meanings.sent4: The storm scolds the trees, shaking their branches violently.
meanings.sent5: The coach scolds the players to push them to perform better on the field.
